baby baby baby boy

I'm meaningful without you

If I couldn't be loved by you

without you without you

And wipe away my tears

Hold another hand I can
get another kind of love

I'm meaningful without you

I'm sick of you

I'm meaningful without you

If I couldn't be loved by you

I don't feel anything (without you)
I don't even cry any more (without you)
Without you I'm okay without you

I'm beautiful without you

without you
without you

comments.text:
She Really Is Beautiful & Extremely Talented O_O ... I Clicked On This 
Thinking I Was Gonna Hear Another Watered Down Fast Paced K-Pop Song With 
Struggling To Sound Good Singers Who Just Look Cute.... BUT....

THEN I STARTED TO HEAR TO THE SONG COME IN O_O ... & She Outshines Every 
Female Korean Artist I've Ever Heard On A Song... This Is Coming From 
Someone Who Knows & Does Music Production... I Heard Pure VOCAL TALENT !  
... I Don't Know Any Korean Female Or Even Male Artist Who Has That "GIFT" 
Or Projection & Sweeping An Audience Off Their Feet & Ears. That Talent Is 
One In A Million. Like Michael Jackson Or Whitney Houston Or Even Usher 
Ramon.

I Feel Michelle Will Be HUGE No Matter Where She Is At. Music Like This 
Just Can't Be Contained... I'M GLAD YG IS TRYING TO BREAK THE RACE 
BARRIER!! I Guarantee As Michelle Goes On, You Will See Other Korean 
Artists Start Copying Her Style. I Hate To Say It, But "BLACK" PEOPLE Just 
Have That GIFT Of Taking Over Anything They Put Their Minds To & Work Hard 
At.

 (please no racist idiot comments. thank you.)﻿

comments.author: Arianna Vang

comments.text:
Jermanos, Nazi anti-Semitism / racism / homophobia wasn't eliminated by 
racism / discrimination against Germans. So nope. When you use anti-Asian 
slurs, you aren't just insulting one person. You are attacking an entire 
group. It's not okay.

Arianna, I'm sorry that some people made racist insults at you. I do think 
it's a positive sign that you thanked people for their comments. I would 
add that while you may not have meant to be derogatory, "even though she's 
black" is still making a racial generalization, so I'd suggest being more 
thoughtful about such statements in the future. Pretty much everyone has 
picked up some racist thinking at some point due to their society, myself 
included. But we can pay attention to it and consciously dismantle our own 
prejudices.

Or if what you meant was that Lee Michelle proved she was a good singer 
despite facing anti-black stigma, rather than despite being black, make 
sure to include important details like that in your comments the first time 
you make them. Otherwise, people will interpret your statement based on 
your wording.

comments.text:
@TheJinroKing First of all you dont know if shes going to do well or not 
so why are you saying she is not. She could be the turning point for korea 
and maybe all of asia. Her story and other blasian peoples story are really 
sad because they get treated like nothing. I bet you if she was korean and 
chinese that wouldnt be a problem. But only because she has black in her 
she is discriminated. I dont see why people cant mix. Mixed people are 
beautiful. Lee michelle is very beautiful. Shes not better of living a 
normal life. She can do whatever she wants to. She can go beyond. Why does 
she have to be normal. Shes different. also Im so sick and tired of what 
they call is perfect. white skin slim body, and sexy. Theres nothing wrong 
with being those but when you have a child thats a little chubbier than 
others why say your fat and this and that. That only leads to low self 
esteem. Im proud of lee michelle she can help alot of people and she has so 
much power in her voice its amazing. She will do great things for korea and 
for other states. ILY LEE MICHELLE ﻿

comments.author: Ye Sul

comments.text:
I love her voice, I love this song, she has so much talent and that's what 
should matter the most! Who cares if she is black! What's the big 
difference between being white or black, does it make you a better or worst 
person?!?! NO! People are beautiful and unique for what they do, for what 
they think, for who they are and how they treat others not for how they 
look in the outside, that's just like the packaging of an object, you can't 
judge how good a product is on less you try it, yes it may appeal more to 
some people because of how it looks but maybe it's not as good or bad as 
you think. And by now nobody is pure race, we are all just a bunch of mixes 
and it shouldn't matter. It's what we do and how we make others and 
ourselves feel what should be more important. In her case, a singer's case, 
her voice and talent is what people should pay attention to, not how she 
looks, you don't just make music with a pretty face, you are not a better 
or worst singer because of your skin color, she deserves much more 
attention, she is so underrated, I am happy to say that she is BEAUTIFUL, 
talented and much more than others think. I wish the best for her, I hope 
she can rise up and be recognized as the amazing singer she is! I hope that 
in the future people finally realize that it's not all about how you look, 
or what you have or wear but about how people is in the inside, how they're 
feelings are. As for the company I have to give them props for debuting 
her, not any Korean company would do it, I just wish that they keep her 
active and not just leave her because she is not getting popular. We are 
all beautiful in our special way, in the inside<3 Spread the love! No to 
haters, be happy, making others smile always comes back in a good result to 
you, doing bad just get things worst, this are the reasons why our world 
has so many bad people because we concentrate more on the negative, because 
we judge without knowing, because we always ignore the pain of others 
instead of helping. Try each day to be a better version of beautiful unique 
you as cheesy as it sounds it does good to everyone C:﻿
comments.author: Jessica spazzer (Love her)

comments.text: She's really something!!! You go girl💜💜💜﻿
